description: An lcUpsOverloadWarningTrap signifies that the UPS
has detected an Overload condition where the output
load has exceeded the UPS's rated capacity.

event.Summary: Output load exceeded UPS rated capacity

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOverloadShutdownTrap signifies that the
UPS has detected an Overload condition where the
output load has exceeded the UPS's rated capacity
and has shut off the output.

event.Summary: UPS shutdown due to overload condition

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOnBatteryTrap signifies that the
UPS is currently on Battery Power.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsLowBatteryWarningTrap signifies that the
UPS has entered a Low Battery state.

event.Summary: UPS is in Low Battery State

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsLowBatteryShutdownTrap signifies that the
UPS has shut off the output due to a Low
Battery state.

event.Summary: UPS shutdown due to low battery

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsUtilPowerFailedTrap signifies that the
utility power input to the UPS has been lost.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsUtilPowerRestoredTrap signifies that the
utility power has been restored to the UPS.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsInputOverVoltageTrap signifies that the
UPS has detected a high input voltage condition.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOverTempWarningTrap signifies that the
UPS has detected a excessive temperature condition.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOverTempShutdownTrap signifies that the
UPS has detected a excessive temperature condition
and shut off the output.

event.Summary: UPS shutdown due to excessive temperature condition

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An Alarm condition has occurred and is being reported
in the lcUpsAlarmTable.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOutputOffTrap is sent when the UPS
turns all of its output off, either at the
inverter or via a relay.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOutputOffWarningTrap is sent when the
lcUpsControlOutputOffDelay reaches the value of
lcUpsControlOutputOffTrapDelay.

event.Summary: UPS output is about to off

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOutputOnTrap is sent when the UPS
turns all of its output back on, either at the
inverter or via a relay.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOutputOnWarningTrap is sent when the
lcUpsControlOutputOnDelay reaches the value of
lcUpsControlOutputOnTrapDelay.

event.Summary: UPS output is about to on

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsUnixShutodwnTrap is sent 2 seconds before
the UPS is scheduled to perform a Unix Shutdown.

event.Summary: UPS scheduled to perform unix shutdown

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsUnixShutdownWarningTrap is sent when the
lcUpsControlUnixShudownDelay reaches the value of
lcUpsControlUnixShutdownTrapDelay.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsReceptOffTrap is sent when the UPS
turns an output receptacle off.

event.Summary: UPS output receptacle $v2 is turned off

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsReceptOffWarningTrap is sent when the
lcUpsSwitchedReceptOffDelay reaches the value of
lcUpsSwitchedReceptOffTrapDelay.

event.Summary: UPS receptacle $v2 is about to off

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsReceptOnTrap is sent when the UPS
turns an output receptacle on.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsReceptOnWarningTrap is sent when the
lcUpsSwitchedReceptOnDelay reaches the value of
lcUpsSwitchedReceptOnTrapDelay.

event.Summary: UPS receptacle $v2 is about to on

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An ldUpsInputFreqErrorTrap signifies that
the UPS has detected that input frequency is outside
tolerable variance.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsDCOverVoltageShutdownTrap signifies that
the UPS has detected that battery voltage is over
the tolarable level.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsOutputOverVoltageTrap signifies that the
UPS has detected that the output voltage is too high.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsFuseBlownTrap is sent when the UPS's
rectifier or DC capacitor fuse has failed.

event.Summary: Rectifier or DC capacitor fuse failed

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsEmergencyPowerOffTrap signifies that
the UPS has shut off output due to an emergency
condition.

event.Summary: UPS output shut off due to an emergency

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsControlPowerFailureTrap signifies a failure in
the secondary control power.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsReversePowerTrap signifies that output has been
shut off due to a reverse power flow condition.

event.Summary: Output shut off due to reverse power flow

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsPhaseRotationErrorTrap signifies a phase-rotation
error in the bypass power.

event.Summary: Phase rotation error in the bypass power

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsLoadOnBypassTrap signifies that the load has
been transferred to bypass power.

event.Summary: UPS load transferred to bypass power

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsEmergencyXferToBypassTrap signifies that the UPS has
automatically tranferred the load to bypass power.

event.Summary: UPS automatically transferred the load to bypass power

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lcUpsInverterFaultTrap signifies that the UPS
detected a problem with the Inverter.
The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An lsUpsCheckAirFilterTrap signifies that the programmed time
interval for checking the air filter has passed and it is time to

The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysUpTime

description: An ldUpsDCOverVoltageShutdownTrap signifies that
the UPS has detected that battery voltage is over
the tolarable level.

event.Summary: Battery voltage exceeded the tolerable level

description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the
network management portion of the system was last
re-initialized.

description: An ldUpsOutputShortShutdownTrap signifies that
the UPS has detected a short circuit across the

re-initialized.

description: An lgUpsInputUVOnStartupTrap signifies that the UPS
